text: Lol i forgot to tell you guys this the other day. So we have our hackathon going on right? Well we had a meeting that included everyone: devs, qa, dbas, etc

The software director asks whos not enjoying it and thinks that their time could be better used doing something else? Well this one QA lady raises her hand. The software director is like "what do you mean? Youre QA and dont want to break the system? Thats like what QA is all about"....QA -"ummm welll idk...."
Lol
What an idiot
It was the same QA lady from a while ago that i complained about lol
every time I submit a PR no one reviews it
so I started slapping memes on them so people review them
it works
Lmao
<@U15HSHSS2> did you guys program at all in your machine learning class?

I still dont understand primary key and foreign key. I get the foreign key means its a key in one table that is a primary key in another table but whats the purpose? To ensure that theres no duplicates?
Like we just made a date field a third primary key for one of our tables
keys are "indexed"
which means they don't have to do a full table scan
databases are crazy with how they perform efficiently
What is a full table scan?
basically you want to have a field indexed if you're filitering by it
So you mean that it looks at those columns primarily when trying to search for things?
Ahh ok

```Full Table Scan (also known as Sequential Scan) is a scan made on a database where each row of the table under scan is read in a sequential (serial) order and the columns encountered are checked for the validity of a condition.```
then theres things called skinny tables
Interesting
I think when something is indexed it creates a map so its search time is O(1) instead of O(n)
Ahh thats pretty cool then
